history.content: I have taken a 4 unit tech with a 4 unit humanities course of the summer. I have done it twice and it is really REALLY busy. I personally like it because it is a shorter amount of time that you feel like you cant have a life and that helps me stay focused, which helps me preform well in the class. I honestly think I did preformed better than I would have during the school year.

I’m a 2nd-semester MechE major interested in switching to EECS. Taking E7 right now and really enjoying it, and planning to take EE16A + R5B over the summer. The change of major policy mentions that you need to have completed N low div EECS classes to declare by your Nth Semester. So I have 2 options, change by the beginning of my 3rd semester (having taken E7, CS61BL, EE16A) or by my 4th semester (in which case I will have to take CS61B + EE16B during fall 2018). 

Which combination do you advise selecting? I want to try to switch ASAP so I don’t have to continue taking required MechE classes, but am unsure how difficult 2 techs over the summer are. 

Thanks for the help.
history.subject: Cours Advice - EECS Change of Major
